metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11691 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when working with XMLHttpRequest (XHR) in an event loop, causing the XHR main thread to be called after it has been freed. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
